alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing leucine or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of leucine at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Leucine and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an alpha amino acid which bears an acyl group at its terminal nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: N-acyl-alpha amino acids

alternative_parents.description: Amino acids having a (-NH2) group attached to the beta carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Beta amino acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing or derived from 1-phenylpropan-2-amine.
alternative_parents.name: Amphetamines and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a fatty acid moiety linked to an amine group through an ester linkage.
alternative_parents.name: N-acyl amines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing one carbohydrate unit not glycosidically linked to another such unit, and no set of two or more glycosidically linked carbohydrate units. Monosaccharides have the general formula CnH2nOn.
alternative_parents.name: Monosaccharides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary carboxylic acid amide functional group, with the general structure RC(=O)N(R')H (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a secondary alcohol functional group, with the general structure HOC(R)(R') (R,R'=alkyl, aryl).
alternative_parents.name: Secondary alcohols

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds that contain at least one carboxyl group and one amino group.
alternative_parents.name: Amino acids

alternative_parents.description: Carboxylic acids containing exactly one carboxyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Monocarboxylic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a carboxylic acid group with the formula -C(=O)OH.
alternative_parents.name: Carboxylic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an primary aliphatic amine group.
alternative_parents.name: Monoalkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

class.description: Compounds containing non-peptidic structural elements that is capable of mimicking or antagonizing the biological action(s) of a natural parent peptide.
class.name: Peptidomimetics

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as hybrid peptides. These are compounds containing at least two different types of amino acids (alpha, beta, gamma, delta) linked to each other through a peptide bond.

direct_parent.description: Compounds containing at least two different types of amino acids (alpha, beta, gamma, delta) linked to each other through a peptide bond.
direct_parent.name: Hybrid peptides

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Compounds containing at least two different types of amino acids (alpha, beta, gamma, delta) linked to each other through a peptide bond.
subclass.name: Hybrid peptides

superclass.description: Compounds an organic acid or a derivative thereof.
superclass.name: Organic acids and derivatives
